metadata.Title: CVE-2020-5214 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
In NetHack before 3.6.5, detecting an unknown configuration file option cancause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote codeexecution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems thathave NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users toupload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack3.6.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-5214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nethack-common - 3.6.6-1
nethack-console - 3.6.6-1
nethack-qt - 3.6.6-1
nethack-x11 - 3.6.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nethack package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.6-1').
